content: abbreviations bor beginning of round cm - centimeters co cast on norwegian fir hat decrease decrease a rustic lacy beanie dpns double pointed needles by judy jewell of the autumn acorn k knit k2tog knit 2 sts together pm place stitch st marker p3tog purl 3 sts together p purl pm place marker repeat repeat round s round s sl slip ssk slip one st as if to k slip second st as if to k k through both loops as one st s stitch es decrease - together yds - yards yo yarn over about knit from the bottom up this sweet lacey hat was made with a gorgeous rustic farm yarn consisting of gotland wool and silk this feminine yet sturdy hat has subtle lace features and is perfect for both running errands in town or adventuring in the forest if you d like your hat to be slouchy simply knit the lace stitch pattern an extra round or two yarn grand view farm yarn 1 2 skeins of 3 ply 80% gotland wool + 20% silk dk wt 150 yds/137 m in natural color jagger this beautiful rustic vermont farm yarn can be found at www grandviewfarmvt com needles us 2/2 75 mm 16 circular or dpns us 5/3 75 mm 16 circular and/or dpns notions 6 7 stitch markers 1 unique to mark bor tapestry needle for weaving in ends measurements/sizes unstretched hat has approximately 4-5 of negative ease small 16 /40 cm circumference at brim med/lg 17 /43 cm circumference at brim small - 18 /46 cm circumference at body med/lg 19 /48 cm circumference at body small - 8 / 20 cm length from brim to crown med/lg 9 /23 cm length from brim to crown 2 gauge 24 sts and 32 rnds = 4 / 10 cm in eyelet lace stitch pattern on larger needles note i had a difficult time figuring out gauge because of the lace stitches so this may not be accurate eyelet lace stitch pattern round 1 k2 *p7 k5 repeat from * to last 10 sts p7 k3 round 2 k around round 3 *yo k2 p2 p3tog p2 k2 yo k1 repeat from * around round 4 k around round 5 k1 *yo k2 p1 p3tog p1 k2 yo k3 repeat from * to last 11 sts yo k2 p1 p3tog p1 k2 yo k2 3 round 6 k around round 7 k2 *yo k2 p3tog k2 yo k5 repeat from * to last 10 sts yo k2 p3tog k2 yo k3 round 8 k around hat ribbed brim using smaller needles co 108 120 sts to make your hat smaller or larger your co number must be divisible by 12 *k2 p2 repeat from * for 8 rnds body using larger needles work rnds 1-8 of eyelet lace stitch pattern 5 6 times on 5th 6th repeat end with round 7 4 crown decrease set-up round k 18 20 *pm k 18 20 repeat from *
